result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J. Esker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon J. Esker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon J. Esker was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Defendant Brandon J. Esker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers: 15CM360, 15CT166 & 15CT167

3:33 pm Court calls case and states appearances.
Court addresses parties.
Atty Redfield indicates there's an agreement as to supervisory program.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Attorney Redfield argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes a statement.

BY THE COURT:
15CT166
Ct 1: 346.63(1)(a) OWI 2nd
PBT: .183
22 days jail, may serve half in and half out electronic monitoring
$1505.00 fine and costs
$26.45 blood draw
15 mos license revocation
15 mos IID on all vehicles owned or titled to the defendant
DOT assessment and safety plan

15CT167
Ct 1: 346.63(1)(a) OWI 3rd
PBT: .146
75 days jail imposed and stayed serve 45 days conditional jail, 14 days in custody and the 31 on electronic monitor consecutive to 15CT166
Defendant to participate in the post trial county probation program for 12 mos  
$2017.00 fine and costs
$33.33 blood draw
28 mos license revocation 
28 mos IID owned or titled and operated by the defendant
DOT assessment 

15CM360
Ct 1: 946.49(1)(a)
30 day jail concurrent to 15CT167
Pay court costs and fees

Court allows Huber for all the time served in jail.
Report to the jail today to set up start date. May serve within 60 days.
Report to the post trial supervisor as soon as possible.
60 days to pay fines or enter into a payment plan.

Defendant Brandon J. Esker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Brandon J. Esker in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM360, 15CM361, 15CT166, 15CT167
3:09 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Will be arguing sentencing. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  
15CT166 Count 1 (OWI 2nd), 15CT167 Count 1 (OWI 3rd), 15CM360 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
15CT166 BAC .183
15CT167 BAC .146

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty: 15CT166 Count 1 (OWI 2nd), 15CT167 Count 1 (OWI 3rd), 15CM360 Count 1 (Bail Jumping).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

15CT166 Count 2 is dismissed. 
15CT167 Count 2 is dismissed.
15CM360 Count 2 is dismissed. 
15CM361 dismissed & read-in in its entirety.

Court asks Atty Redfield to make his recommendations for each file. 
Atty Redfield states recommendations to the Court. 
Court notes he is not aware if he can place the defendant in the post-trial supervision program without the DA's consent.  Would need to research that program first.  
Atty Redfield requests an adjournment.  Makes additional statements.  

BY THE COURT:
Court will adjourn.  
Parties are to submit in writing their positions.  
Atty Knaapen asks the Judge to speak with Judge Flugaur or Judge Eagon re: the program.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Comply with all other bonds defendant is currently under.

Defendant Brandon J. Esker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM360 & 15CM361

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond covering both files with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
